title: Standard Coordinates
text: To find $$[b_1]_c$$ , we can first convert to standard coordinates.

title: Standard Basis
text: The standard basis for $$P_1$$ is {1,t}, so $$[b_1]_{\epsilon}=$$ $$\begin{bmatrix} 24 \\ 8 \end{bmatrix}$$ , $$[c_1]_{\epsilon}=$$ $$\begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, $$[c_2]_{\epsilon}=$$ $$\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ .

title: Row Reduction
text: If we row reduce the augmented matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} 4 & 0 & 24 \\ 1 & 2 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$ what value do we get for $$[b_1]_c$$ ?

title: Row Reduction
text: If we row reduce the augmented matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} 4 & 0 & 24 \\ 1 & 2 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$ what value do we get for $$[b_2]_c$$ ?
